wikipedia_page.main: Cecil Leonard Knox VC (9 May 1889 – 4 February 1943) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: * Cecil Leonard Knox, soldier, recipient of the Victoria Cross (born in Nuneaton)

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Cecil Leonard Knox || British Army || 1918 || First World War || Tugny
*Cecil Leonard Knox VC, recipient of the Victoria Cross for action during the Great War
* Cecil Leonard Knox, English recipient of the Victoria Cross
During this action William Neilly led a small team under the command of Second Lieutenant Cecil Leonard Knox, who also led a team. Second Lieutenant Knox was awarded the Victoria Cross for his part.
